casebody.data:
ZLOOP, INC.
v.
PARKER POE ADAMS & BERNSTEIN, LLP, Alba-Justina Secrist a/k/a AJ Secrist and R. Douglas Harmon No. 122PA18 Supreme Court of North Carolina. October 1, 2018 Gavin J. Reardon, Attorney at Law, Greensboro, Amiel J. Rossabi, Attorney at Law, for Zloop, INC. Robert W. Fuller, Attorney at Law, Stuart L. Pratt, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Parker Poe Adams & Bernstein, LLP, et al.

ORDER

On 20 September 2018, this Court allowed Plaintiff's petition for writ of certiorari to review the decision of the North Carolina Business Court. The record on appeal in this matter shall be due no later than fifteen (15) days from the filing date of this Order. The Appellant's brief shall be due thirty (30) days from the filing of the record in accordance with the North Carolina Rules of Appellate Procedure.

By the order of the Court in Conference, this the 1 st day of October, 2018.
